column1: #Text=Chronic lymphocytic leukemia ( CLL ) , autoimmune hemolytic anemia , and oral ulcer .
#Text=The patient was diagnosed with chronic lymphocytic leukemia and was noted to have autoimmune hemolytic anemia at the time of his CLL diagnosis .
#Text=The patient is a 72 - year - old gentleman who was diagnosed with chronic lymphocytic leukemia in May 2008 .
#Text=He was noted to have autoimmune hemolytic anemia at the time of his CLL diagnosis .
#Text=He has been on chronic steroids to control his hemolysis and is currently on prednisone 5 mg every other day .
#Text=He comes in to clinic today for follow - up and complete blood count .
#Text=At his last office visit we discontinued this prophylactic antivirals and antibacterial .
#Text=Prilosec 20 mg b.i.d. , levothyroxine 50 mcg q.d. , Lopressor 75 mg q.d. , vitamin C 500 mg q.d. , multivitamin q.d. , simvastatin 20 mg q.d. , and prednisone 5 mg q.o.d.
#Text=The patient reports ulcer on his tongue and his lip .
#Text=He has been off of Valtrex for five days .
#Text=He is having some difficulty with his night vision with his left eye .
#Text=He denies any fevers , chills , or night sweats .
#Text=The rest of his review of systems is negative .
#Text=He has a obvious cold sore on his bottom lip on the left .
#Text=Pupils are equal , round , and reactive to light .
#Text=His oropharynx is notable for ulcer on his tongue .
#Text=He has no cervical or supraclavicular adenopathy .
#Text=CV : Regular rate ; normal S1 , S2 , no murmurs .
#Text=His white blood cell count is 4.6 , hemoglobin 14.2 , hematocrit 42 , and platelets 207,000 .
#Text=This is a 72 - year - old gentleman with chronic lymphocytic leukemia on chronic steroids for autoimmune hemolytic anemia .
#Text=His blood counts are relatively stable at 5 mg of prednisone every other day .
#Text=We will plan on putting him back on the Valtrex and decreasing his steroids to 1 mg daily .
#Text=I will see him back in clinic in a week .
